::Prowl::

If the situation was less serious, Prowl would have smiled at Iron 
Raptor for her comment, but he was busy listening to Iris. The side 
effects could be death, but he didn't care, as long as it would help 
Iron Raptor.

"Doesn't sound too complicated," he simply replies to Iris, looking 
back at Iron Raptor.

"I think we should get a bit into the wilderness though, so we 
wouldn't cause too much trouble here if something bad does happen."

His mind was merely brishing the threat of death aside, knowing that 
it was worth it for him to die for Iron Raptor.



--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "Megan Solmonson" <tmrattrap@h...> wrote:
> 
> 
> * Iron Raptor watched Prowl just as intently as she watched and 
listened to 
> Iris, wondering if he would really give up half his spark for her. 
But she 
> knew him, and even before she heard his reply she knew that he 
would do it.
> She raised her head from her front limbs and stoof on all fours as 
she heard 
> Prowl replyintent in hearing what Iris' answer was going to be.
> 
> Iris would have nodded in understanding at Prowls answer...if she 
would have 
> had a head to begin with. But she simply just got down to business.*
> 
> IRIS: " Prowl...it's very simple but very dangerouse. It has been 
tried a 
> first time and in the end both sparks died, evaporated. You're 
taking a 
> great risk, but I admire your courage."
> 
> * Iron Raptor stepped forward.*
> 
> " That's what he's known for..."
> 
> * And with that she gave Prowl a little glance but then glued her 
eyes to 
> the star in the cracked screen again, wanting to hear just what he 
had to 
> do.
> But it always seemed that Prowl was always the one who saved her in 
the 
> end...he wouldn't let her down now.*
> 
> IRIS: " Well, known for it or not, at least you know the prices now.
> Anyway, all you have to do Prowl is merge your spark with hers, 
stablizing 
> her corrupted spark and thus calming her beats modes.
> There might be some side effects but nothing too seriouse I don't 
think...*
> 
> 
>
